audio_caption: The audio clip begins with an upbeat introduction from a female speaker welcoming viewers back to her channel, mentioning her name as "Caitlyn." She informs the audience that she will be making a second revision video, providing advice and revision techniques. She mentions the previous video she made. She excitedly announces this video is in collaboration with "Pentel," a stationary brand that is sponsoring the video, and encourages viewers to check out their products. The female speaker mentions that she will leave a link to their website and socials below. The audio then transitions to the background with a swishing sound effect, before resuming with the female speaker stating that she is "going to get into my part two revision video". She ends off by asking that the viewers enjoy, give the video a thumbs up, and to subscribe if new to the channel.

The clip starts with a female speaker introducing her first tip, suggesting "to find a place that you want to do your revision in," maintaining consistency in the chosen spot. She highlights that doing so "helps with your general mindset," adding that she likes to study in a cafe. This speaking portion transitions to a sound effect, followed again by a female speaker who moves on to her next tip, which is "to take pride in your notes and make them beautiful."

A young, enthusiastic female speaker mentions having separate notebooks for each subject, containing title pages organized into lecture slides, tutorial questions, and exam questions, to help keep everything organized, particularly when stuck. She then highlights her favorite Pentel EnerGel pens which she uses throughout the year because they dry fast, useful because she's left-handed and smears her notes. She adds that they are comfortable to use and the ink is of high quality. Finally, a sound similar to scratching a chalkboard is heard.

The clip begins with a female speaker introducing the topic of whether one is a "mind map person" or a "bullet point person," mentioning a friend who uses mind maps for essay plans but finding them messy. She then describes her preference for bullet point essay plans, with titles for paragraphs and bullet points for key points. She suggests bullet points for those who never look at their mind maps, implying it might be more enjoyable.

The audio begins with a female speaker describing the variety of colors available in a pen range, noting how they can be used for decoration, and how users can “go as crazy as you want with color.” This is followed by a sound of quick scribbling on paper. Next, another female speaker recommends finding a revision TV show as an incentive during exams, suggesting something light-hearted like a rom-com to avoid affecting your mood. She says to watch one episode in the morning, one during lunch, and one in the evening as a reward, saying it keeps exam time from being too stressful because you have things to look forward to.

A female speaker discusses her study habits, specifically flashcards, in a casual, conversational tone. Then the sound of rustling paper is heard. The speaker continues, recommending planning something to look forward to after exams to give one hope. At the very end there is a short sound effect.

The audio clip features a single female speaker giving advice, urging listeners to "delete social media if necessary" if they feel easily distracted. She speaks in a casual, conversational tone, recounting her personal experience of deleting Instagram during exam time because it was "making me feel really, really bad about myself." She concludes that it's surprisingly easy to adapt to not using social media and suggests doing so "just for exam time." Shortly after, the sound of writing on a chalkboard is audible.

The clip features a single speaker with a lively tone, providing a tip about revising with a friend, emphasizing that "you don't really want to start" alone and the benefit of tackling issues together. They add that "you can kind of just mix your knowledge together and before you know it, you'll know everything." The speech concludes with the sound of the speaker exhaling.

The audio clip begins with a female speaker, who says "I also find when I hear it from somebody else and when somebody is verbalizing something to me, I learn it a lot better than if I was gonna read it from a textbook." Her tone suggests a casual conversation. Following this, there is a brief scrubbing sound, and then the same female speaker says "is I".

The clip starts with a single female speaker, who explains that she does not make study plans, instead preferring lists. She states that she enjoys ticking off and scoring things out to feel productive. She also mentions she dislikes time tables, so instead she makes lists of what she wants to achieve for her whole revision time, then the week, and finally the day. She creates each list right before it is needed. The female speaker speaks in a conversational and enthusiastic tone.

The audio clip starts with a female speaker discussing organizational and planning strategies, referring to what works best for her, in an informative tone. A faint scratching sound is heard. The speaker then continues with a tip, advising not to become "a study poo".

The clip begins with a female speaker strongly advising against a specific study habit, emphasizing the importance of self-care for overall productivity and well-being. She advocates for a balanced approach, warning against feeling “minging” and “rubbish” from constant revision. She concludes her discussion of revision techniques and mentions that she hopes the video has been helpful and plugging a product. The clip concludes with background music transitioning into a pop song.
